title: Vander Decken Won't Die That Easily
theory: Despite being stabbed by Hody Jones, many fans theorized that Vander Decken IX would not die from this wound and would instead fall defeated in some kind of comedic situation, rather than from a serious fatal injury. Fans believed the main conflict would remain Hody against Luffy.
author: Arlong Park Forums Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory about Vander Decken's fate after being stabbed

resolution: Vander Decken survived the stabbing and his fate was resolved in later episodes

title: Noah's Fall Mechanics and Devil Fruit Deactivation
theory: Fans discussed the mechanics of how Vander Decken's Mark-Mark Fruit powers would deactivate upon his death, causing Noah to fall directly onto Fish-Man Island. This led to theories about whether Hody's plan would succeed and how Luffy would need to stop the falling ship even if Decken died.
author: Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theories about how Noah's fall would be stopped

resolution: The theory about Devil Fruit deactivation proved correct, requiring Luffy to stop Noah physically

title: Hody's True Motivations for Destroying Fish-Man Island
theory: Fans theorized about Hody's betrayal of Vander Decken revealing his true goal - not just defeating humans or the Straw Hats, but actively destroying Fish-Man Island itself to perpetuate the cycle of hatred. This suggested Hody represented hatred for hatred's sake, with no personal justification.
author: Various Fans

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains analysis of Hody's motivations and character arc conclusion

resolution: Later episodes confirmed Hody had no personal reason for his hatred, representing inherited prejudice
